{{primarysources|date=August 2011}} {{Infobox Software | name = Beagle | screenshot = [[Image:Beagle-search.png|250px]] | logo = [[Image:Beagle logo.png|60px]] | caption = A screenshot of Beagle's UI | developer = Beagle Team | latest release version = 0.3.9 (no further development at the moment) | latest release date = {{release date and age|2009|01|26}} | operating system = [[Linux]], other [[Unix]] and Unix-like systems | genre = [[desktop search|Search tool]] | license = A mix of the [[MIT License|X11/MIT License]] and the [[Apache License]] | website = (was - now parked domain) http://www.beagle-project.org | status = Unmaintained }} [[Image:Best.png|thumb|Old user interface for Beagle, code named Best]] '''Beagle''' is a [[desktop search|search system]] for [[Linux]] and other such modern [[Unix-like]] systems, enabling the user to search documents, chat logs, email and contact lists in a similar way to [[Spotlight (software)|Spotlight]] in [[Mac OS X]], and [[Windows Search]] or [[Google Desktop]] (third party) under [[Linux]] or [[Microsoft Windows]]. It is [http://mail.gnome.org/archives/dashboard-hackers/2010-January/msg00001.html not actively developed].
Beagle grew out of [http://nat.org/dashboard/ Dashboard], an early [[Mono (software)|Mono]]-based application for watching and presenting useful information from a user's computer. It is written in [[C Sharp (programming language)|C#]] using Mono and uses a port of [[Lucene]] to C# called [[Lucene.net]] as its [[Search engine indexing|indexer]]. Beagle includes a [[Gtk Sharp|Gtk#]]-based user interface, and integrates with [[Galago (software)|Galago]] for [[presence information]].
Beagle was developed and maintained by [[Joe Shaw (programmer)|Joe Shaw]], with help from the [[open source]] community. Other notable past contributors include [[Jon Trowbridge]], [[Robert Love]], [[Nat Friedman]], and [[David Camp (programmer)|David Camp]].
== Features == Beagle searches the content of documents and associated metadata. With Beagle, users can search for: * Applications * Archives ([[ZIP (file format)|zip]], [[tar (file format)|tar]], [[gzip]], [[bzip2]]) and their contents * Conversations ([[Pidgin (software)|Pidgin]], [[Kopete]] and [[IRC]] logs) * Documents ([[AbiWord]], [[OpenOffice.org]], [[Microsoft Office]], [[Portable Document Format|pdf]], [[.txt|txt]], [[Rich Text Format|rtf]], [[html]]) * [[Email]]s and Address Book contacts (from [[Novell Evolution|Evolution]], [[Mozilla Thunderbird]] (header info only), and [[KMail]]) * Help files ([[Texinfo]], [[man pages]]) * Images ([[Portable Network Graphics|png]], [[JPEG|jpg]], [[TIFF|tiff]], [[GIF|gif]], [[SVG|svg]]) * Music files ([[MP3|mp3]], [[ogg]], [[FLAC|flac]]) * Notes taken in [[Tomboy (software)|Tomboy]], [[KNotes]], and Labyrinth * [[RSS (file format)|RSS]] feeds (via [[Blam (software)|Blam]] or [[Akregator]]) * [[Source code]] ([[C (programming language)|C]], [[C++]], [[C Sharp (programming language)|C#]], [[Fortran]], [[Java (programming language)|Java]], [[JavaScript]], [[Pascal (programming language)|Pascal]], [[Perl]], [[PHP]], [[Python (programming language)|Python]], and more) * Video files (through [[MPlayer]] or [[Totem (media player)|Totem]]) * Web history ([[Firefox]], [[Konqueror]], [[Epiphany (web browser)|Epiphany]])
Beagle can also index additional file types not natively supported using external tools through a configuration file.
Beagle can efficiently index documents on Linux systems using [[inotify]].
